byline.original: By ANNIE CORREAL and COLLEEN WRIGHT

abstract: Greeks in Astoria, Queens, where they reside in high numbers, have been deeply involved in following drama at home; referendum has prompted elation, fear and debates over future of their homeland.
lead_paragraph: As word spread in Astoria, a Greek enclave in Queens, New York, that their countrymen had rejected the terms of the rescue package, many people in the neighborhood cheered the vote.

headline.main: Greeks in New York Talk and Cheer, Then Debate Future After Referendum
headline.print_headline: Greeks in New York Talk and Cheer, Then Debate Future After Referendum

snippet: As word spread in Astoria, a Greek enclave in Queens, New York, that their countrymen had rejected the terms of the rescue package, many people in the neighborhood cheered the vote.
